org.jtrim.event

Class ListenerRegistries

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.event.ListenerRegistries

  • public final class ListenerRegistries
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines static utility methods for listener registries.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • combineListenerRefs

        public static ListenerRef combineListenerRefs(ListenerRef... refs)
        Returns a combination of multiple ListenerRef instances. That is, the returned ListenerRef is registered, if, and only, if at least one of the specified ListenerRef instances is registered. Also, unregistering the returned ListenerRef will cause all the wrapped ListenerRef instances to be unregistered.

        Unregistering the returned ListenerRef will cause the unregister method of all the specified ListenerRef instances to be called. In case some of them throws an exception, the first exception to be thrown will be propagated to the caller and others will be suppressed (via Throwable.addSuppressed(Throwable).

        Note: Passing an empty array will return a ListenerRef which is always considered to be unregistered.

        Parameters:
        refs - the ListenerRef instances to be combined. This argument cannot be null and none of the ListenerRef instances can be null.
        Returns:
        a combination of multiple ListenerRef instances. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the ListenerRef instances (or the array itself) is null

      • combineListenerRefs

        public static ListenerRef combineListenerRefs(java.util.Collection<? extends ListenerRef> refs)
        Returns a combination of multiple ListenerRef instances. That is, the returned ListenerRef is registered, if, and only, if at least one of the specified ListenerRef instances is registered. Also, unregistering the returned ListenerRef will cause all the wrapped ListenerRef instances to be unregistered.

        Unregistering the returned ListenerRef will cause the unregister method of all the specified ListenerRef instances to be called. In case some of them throws an exception, the first exception to be thrown will be propagated to the caller and others will be suppressed (via Throwable.addSuppressed(Throwable).

        Note: Passing an empty collection will return a ListenerRef which is always considered to be unregistered.

        Parameters:
        refs - the ListenerRef instances to be combined. This argument cannot be null and none of the ListenerRef instances can be null. Note that the content of this collection is not allowed to be changed during this method call.
        Returns:
        a combination of multiple ListenerRef instances. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the ListenerRef instances (or the collection itself) is null
